Pre-Game Insights: Kane Williamson-led New Zealand is currently leading the chart with three points and +4.450 net-run rate.
New Zealand registered a comprehensive win over Australia in the World Cup opener and settled with one point as the match against Afghanistan was abandoned due to constant rain.
Sri Lanka clinched the opening game against Ireland by 9 wickets but were completely outplayed by defending champions Australia in their last fixture.
Sydney Cricket Ground provides great edge to the batters and close to 180 can be expected score from the team batting first.
The surface also provides true pace and bounce, and bowlers will need to ready themselves well to make a mark in the game.
Pathum Nissanka and Kusal Mendis were crucial at the top-order as both the batters played instrumental knocks in the first two games.
Dhananjaya de Silva also played vital knocks in both the games and the team will rely heavily on him in the game vs New Zealand.
Charith Asalanka's 38 off 25 deliveries was also a key contribution from the side against Australia.
Bhanuka Rajapaksa and Dasun Shanaka need to step up as the going gets tough.
Maheesh Theekshana and Wanindu Hasaranga picked two wickets in the first game but leaked too many runs against Australia.
Bowling will be a main concern for Sri Lanka as the bowlers have been leaking too many runs.
Devon Conway-propelled New Zealand to 200/3 in the first innings with his brilliant 92 off 58 deliveries against Australia.
Finn Allen delivered another noteworthy performance against Australia as he smashed 42 off 16 deliveries.
New Zealand's middle-order stepped up against Australia and will be looking strong against Sri Lanka.
James Neesham (26 off 13) also played a superb knock vs Australia.
Mitchell Santner and Tim Southee picked three wickets in the opening game and the team will hope for a similar performance from the squad against Sri Lanka.
